page.title: 05FARMING IN HIGHER POYNTON(2)
page.content: All the farm families had to have an extra income to help pay for the running of their farm, even at Hilltop. For example there was a taxi driver, marine engineer, shopkeeper and a teacher.On one farm both the owner and his wife were part-time vets which must be very useful when their cattle are ill. All the farms had some form of transport, such as a land-rover or van, only the larger farms had a lot of equipment. They said their most useful pieces of equipment were tractors,trailers, haybailers, and silage harvesters.Many of the farms had outbuildings varying in size,for storing machinery,animal food and equipment. Most were a long way from the main roads with cattle- grids at the entrance to the tracks.
